intro: Dessenia scoparia, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water in dry environments. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to anchor itself in sandy soils and access moisture from deeper layers. Dessenia scoparia plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion in its native habitat.
